subject: Re: [junit] Junit output on assertEquals
msgSnippet: Now I see what the other folks were talking about. This is not good. Kent, Erich, if you re watching, here are some stories for you and your crew. I want to
messageBody:
Now I see what the other folks were talking about. This is not good.

Kent, Erich, if you're watching, here are some stories for you and your
crew.

I want to see the full strings in a ComparisonFailure if they are no
more than 40 characters long enough.

I want to know at which character index the first difference occurs.

If the strings are long (> 40 characters), I want at least 10
characters of context on either side of the beginning of the
difference.

Thanks.

So said uweanimal <justin.thomas@...> on 2003-01-30
--------------------

>Hi,
>
>When my test fails I get a truncated difference of the actual
>against expected. This is really annoying as more often than not
>it's too difficult to tell which part the difference comes from.
>
>For example this test fails with the following output:
>
>[junit] Convert JDN 10000: expected:<...1> but was:<...2>
>[junit] junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: Convert JDN 10000:
>expected:<...1> but was:<...2>
>
>[junit] TEST com.calendar.tests.gregorianTest FAILED
>
>The bit in angle brackets is useless to me what it should say is
>expected:<"-4685/4/12"> but was:<"-4685/4/11">. Can anyone tell me
>how to stop the output being truncated like this?
>
>Thanks
>
>
>
>To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
>junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
